00011 #include "Minet.h"

00013 //
00014 // Define this to be nonzero if you're using libnet 1.1 instead of 1.0
00015 //
00016 #define LIBNET11 1
00017 
00018 
00019 /*
00020    Simpler device driver for Minet
00021    No signals are used here.
00022 */
00023 
00024 using std::cout;
00025 using std::cerr;
00026 using std::endl;
00027 
00028 
00029 // device config
00030 //
00031 char *device;
00032 
00033 // libnet stuff
00034 char net_errbuf[LIBNET_ERRORBUF_SIZE];
00035 #if LIBNET11
00036 libnet_t *net_interface;
00037 #else
00038 struct libnet_link_int *net_interface;
00039 #endif
00040 
00041 // libpcap stuff
00042 const int pcap_proglen=10240;
00043 char pcap_program[pcap_proglen];
00044 pcap_t *pcap_interface;
00045 char pcap_errbuf[PCAP_ERRBUF_SIZE];
00046 struct bpf_program pcap_filter;
00047 bpf_u_int32 pcap_net, pcap_mask;
00048 int pcap_fd;
00049 
00050 // minet stuff
00051 // note that this currently will only work with the fifo-based
00052 // communication.
00053 MinetHandle ethermux_handle;
00054 MinetHandle pcap_handle;
00055 
00056 void Init()
00057 {
00058   // get configuration
00059   if (!(device=getenv("MINET_ETHERNETDEVICE"))) {
00060     cerr << "Please set MINET_ETHERNETDEVICE\n";
00061     exit(-1);
00062   }
00063 
00064   // establish libnet session
00065 #if LIBNET11
00066   net_interface=libnet_init(LIBNET_LINK_ADV,device,net_errbuf);
00067 #else
00068   net_interface=libnet_open_link_interface(device,net_errbuf);
00069 #endif
00070   if (net_interface==NULL) {
00071     cerr<<"Can't open interface: "<<net_errbuf<<endl;
00072     exit(-1);
00073   }
00074 
00075   // establish pcap filter
00076   if (pcap_lookupnet(device,&pcap_net,&pcap_mask,pcap_errbuf)) {
00077     cerr<<"Can't get net and mask for "<<device<<": "<<pcap_errbuf<<endl;
00078 
00079     exit(-1);
00080   }
00081   cerr << "pcap_net="<<pcap_net<<", pcap_mask="<<pcap_mask<<endl;
00082   if ((pcap_interface=pcap_open_live(device,1518,1,0,pcap_errbuf))==NULL) {
00083     cerr<< "Can't open "<<device<<":"<<pcap_errbuf<<endl;
00084     exit(-1);
00085   }
00086   char *ip=getenv("MINET_IPADDR");
00087   if (ip==0) {
00088     cerr << "Set MINET_IPADDR"<<endl;
00089     exit(-1);
00090   }
00091   //
00092   // This is crucial.  It controls what your students will see
00093   //
00094   sprintf(pcap_program,"host %s or arp",ip);
00095   cerr <<"pcap_program='"<<pcap_program<<"'"<<endl;
00096   if (pcap_compile(pcap_interface,&pcap_filter,pcap_program,0,pcap_mask)) {
00097     cerr<<"Can't compile filter\n";
00098     exit(-1);
00099   }
00100   if (pcap_setfilter(pcap_interface,&pcap_filter)) {
00101     cerr<<"Can't set filter\n";
00102     exit(-1);
00103   }
00104   pcap_fd=pcap_fileno(pcap_interface);
00105 
00106   // connect to the ethernet mux
00107   MinetInit(MINET_DEVICE_DRIVER);
00108   ethermux_handle=MinetIsModuleInConfig(MINET_ETHERNET_MUX) ? MinetAccept(MINET_ETHERNET_MUX) : MINET_NOHANDLE;
00109   // register pcap as an external connection
00110   pcap_handle=MinetAddExternalConnection(pcap_fd,pcap_fd);
00111 }
00112 
00113 void ProcessIncoming()
00114 {
00115   struct pcap_pkthdr header;
00116   const u_char *packet;
00117 
00118   packet=pcap_next(pcap_interface,&header);
00119 
00120   if (packet==NULL) {
00121     cerr <<"pcap_next returned a null pointer\n";
00122     exit(-1);
00123   }
00124 
00125   RawEthernetPacket p((const char *)packet,(unsigned)(header.len));
00126 
00127   MinetSend(ethermux_handle,p);
00128 }
00129 
00130 void ProcessOutgoing()
00131 {
00132   RawEthernetPacket p;
00133 
00134   MinetReceive(ethermux_handle,p);
00135 
00136   //
00137   //
00138   // Make sure that the packet is allowed to be sent
00139   //
00140   Packet cp(p);
00141   cp.ExtractHeaderFromPayload<EthernetHeader>(ETHERNET_HEADER_LEN);
00142   EthernetHeader eh=cp.FindHeader(Headers::EthernetHeader);
00143   EthernetAddr ea;
00144   EthernetProtocol ep;
00145   eh.GetSrcAddr(ea);
00146   eh.GetProtocolType(ep);
00147 
00148 
00149   if (ea!=MyEthernetAddr || (ep!=PROTO_ARP && ep!=PROTO_IP)) {
00150     cerr << "discarding packet "<<p<<endl;
00151     MinetSendToMonitor(MinetMonitoringEvent("dropped illegal outgoing packet"));
00152     return;
00153   }
00154 
00155 
00156 #if LIBNET11
00157   if (libnet_adv_write_link(net_interface,
00158                               (u_char *)(p.data),
00159                               p.size)<0) {
00160 #else
00161   if (libnet_write_link_layer(net_interface,
00162                               (const char *)device,
00163                               (u_char *)(p.data),
00164                               p.size)<0) {
00165 #endif
00166       cerr << "Can't write output packet to link\n";
00167       exit(-1);
00168   }
00169 }
00170 
00171 
00172 void Run()
00173 {
00174   MinetSendToMonitor(MinetMonitoringEvent("device_driver2 operating"));
00175   cerr << "device_driver2 operating" << endl;
00176 
00177   MinetEvent event;
00178 
00179   while (MinetGetNextEvent(event)==0) {
00180     if (event.eventtype!=MinetEvent::Dataflow
00181         || event.direction!=MinetEvent::IN) {
00182       MinetSendToMonitor(MinetMonitoringEvent("Unknown event ignored."));
00183       cerr << "Unknown event ignored." << endl;
00184     } else {
00185       if (event.handle==ethermux_handle) {
00186         ProcessOutgoing();
00187       } else if (event.handle==pcap_handle) {
00188         ProcessIncoming();
00189       } else {
00190         MinetSendToMonitor(MinetMonitoringEvent("Unknown handle ignored."));
00191         cerr << "Unknown handle ignored." << endl;
00192       }
00193     }
00194   }
00195 }
00196 
00197 
00198 
00199 
00200 
00201 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00202 {
00203   Init();
00204   Run();
00205 }
